content:
TITLE: Configuring RevenueCat SDK with New Object Parameters
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the new configure method which replaces setUp. The method now accepts a configuration object with various options including API key, user ID, observer mode settings, and store preferences.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
Purchases.configure({
    apiKey: "key",
    appUserID: "user ID",
    observerMode: false,
    userDefaultsSuiteName: "suite name",
    usesStoreKit2IfAvailable: true,
    useAmazon: true
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Presenting RevenueCat Paywall in React Native
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code example demonstrating how to implement and present a RevenueCat paywall modal with required entitlement checking
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import RevenueCatUI, { PAYWALL_RESULT } from "../react-native-purchases-ui";

async function presentPaywallIfNeeded() {
    const paywallResult: PAYWALL_RESULT = await RevenueCatUI.presentPaywallIfNeeded({
        requiredEntitlementIdentifier: "pro"
    });
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring RevenueCat SDK with Optional InApp Messages Setting in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to configure the RevenueCat SDK using the Purchases.configure method, including the optional shouldShowInAppMessagesAutomatically property that controls whether in-app messages should be displayed automatically.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
Purchases.configure({
    apiKey,
    appUserID,
    observerMode,
    userDefaultsSuiteName,
    usesStoreKit2IfAvailable,
    useAmazon,
    shouldShowInAppMessagesAutomatically
  });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Amazon Store Support in React Native Purchases SDK
DESCRIPTION: Code example showing how to configure the SDK to use the Amazon Store by passing a configuration object with the Amazon API key and enabling the Amazon store flag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
Purchases.configure({ apiKey: "AMAZON_API_KEY", useAmazon: true });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring StoreKit Version in RevenueCat SDK
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to configure the SDK with a specific StoreKit version using the new storeKitVersion parameter, which replaces the deprecated usesStoreKit2IfAvailable parameter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/migrations/v8-MIGRATION.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
Purchases.configure({
    apiKey,
    STOREKIT_VERSION.STOREKIT_1,
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing RevenueCat UI Dependencies in package.json
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration showing how to include the RevenueCat UI package dependencies in package.json for using paywalls functionality
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "dependencies": {
    "react-native-purchases": "7.15.0",
    "react-native-purchases-ui": "7.15.0"
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Filtering Subscription Options in RevenueCat React Native v6
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to filter different types of subscription options from a StoreProduct, including base plans, default options, free offers, and trial offers. This demonstrates the new multi-offer functionality available in v6.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/migrations/v6-MIGRATION.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: dart
CODE:
```
const basePlan = storeProduct.subscriptionOptions?.filter((option) => { option.isBasePlan });
const defaultOption = storeProduct.defaultOption
const freeOffer = storeProduct.subscriptionOptions?.filter((option) => { !!option.freePhase });
const trialOffer = storeProduct.subscriptionOptions?.filter((option) => { !!option.introPhase });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring RevenueCat SDK with Multiple Parameters
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the new configure method with multiple parameters. It includes setting the API key, user ID, observer mode, user defaults suite name, and enabling Amazon store support.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/v4_to_v5_migration_guide.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
Purchases.configure({
    apiKey: "key",
    appUserID: "user ID",
    observerMode: false,
    userDefaultsSuiteName: "suite name",
    useAmazon: true
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Amazon Store Support in RevenueCat SDK
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to enable Amazon Store support in the RevenueCat SDK using the new configure function. It requires an Amazon API key and setting the useAmazon flag to true.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/v4_to_v5_migration_guide.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
Purchases.configure({ apiKey: "AMAZON_API_KEY", useAmazon: true });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring PurchasesAreCompletedBy in RevenueCat SDK
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to configure the SDK to specify that purchases are completed by your app, replacing the deprecated Observer Mode terminology. Requires specifying the StoreKit version for iOS implementations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/migrations/v8-MIGRATION.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
Purchases.configure({
    apiKey,
    appUserID,
    {
        type: PURCHASES_ARE_COMPLETED_BY_TYPE.MY_APP,
        storeKitVersion: STOREKIT_VERSION.STOREKIT_2,
    },
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring App-Completed Purchases with StoreKit 1
DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring the SDK for apps that complete their own purchases using StoreKit 1, explicitly setting the StoreKit version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/migrations/v8-MIGRATION.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
Purchases.configure({
    apiKey,
    appUserID,
    {
        type: PURCHASES_ARE_COMPLETED_BY_TYPE.MY_APP,
        storeKitVersion: STOREKIT_VERSION.STOREKIT_1,
    },
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing react-native-purchases SDK with Expo
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the react-native-purchases SDK in an Expo project. This should be run after creating a new project and setting up a development build environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx expo install react-native-purchases
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Recording Purchases for macOS StoreKit 2
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to manually record purchases when using StoreKit 2 on macOS to ensure immediate purchase detection by RevenueCat.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/migrations/v8-MIGRATION.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
await Purchases.recordPurchase(productID);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Version Compatibility Matrix in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Markdown table displaying version compatibility between RevenueCat React Native SDK and its various dependencies across platforms. Includes version numbers and links to release notes for iOS SDK, Android SDK, Common Files, and Play Billing Library.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/VERSIONS.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Version       | iOS version | Android version | Common files version  | Play Billing Library version |
|---------------|-------------|-----------------|-----------------------|------------------------------|
| 8.9.5 | [5.21.2](https://github.com/RevenueCat/purchases-ios/releases/tag/5.21.2) | [8.16.1](https://github.com/RevenueCat/purchases-android/releases/tag/8.16.1) | [13.28.1](https://github.com/RevenueCat/purchases-hybrid-common/releases/tag/13.28.1) | [7.1.1](https://developer.android.com/google/play/billing/release-notes) |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Bootstrapping react-native-purchases Development Environment
DESCRIPTION: Command to bootstrap the development environment for react-native-purchases. This links the local package to the purchaseTesterTypescript example so changes are automatically applied.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/DEVELOPMENT.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn bootstrap
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running PurchaseTesterTypescript on Android or iOS
DESCRIPTION: Commands to run the purchaseTesterTypescript example app on Android or iOS devices from the root of the repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/DEVELOPMENT.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn example android
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx example ios
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Local Build for Android with PurchasesHybridCommon
DESCRIPTION: Gradle command to enable local build in Android development, linking to a local purchases-hybrid-common repository for on-the-fly editing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/DEVELOPMENT.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
gradle enableLocalBuild -PcommonPath="$HOME/Development/repos/purchases-hybrid-common/android"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running MagicWeather Example Application
DESCRIPTION: Commands to build dependencies and run the MagicWeather example app on iOS or Android. These should be executed from the MagicWeather directory since it's a separate project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/DEVELOPMENT.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn pods
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn ios
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn android
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with npm in React Native
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install project dependencies using npm for the Magic Weather React Native sample app.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/examples/MagicWeather/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd react-native-purchases/examples/MagicWeather
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing iOS Dependencies with CocoaPods in React Native
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install iOS-specific dependencies using CocoaPods for the Magic Weather React Native sample app.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/examples/MagicWeather/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd ios
pod install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running React Native App on iOS Simulator
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Magic Weather React Native app on an iOS simulator.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/examples/MagicWeather/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run ios
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running React Native App on Android Device
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Magic Weather React Native app on an Android device or emulator.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/examples/MagicWeather/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run android
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating PurchasesHybridCommon Version
DESCRIPTION: Fastlane command to update the PurchasesHybridCommon version in the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/DEVELOPMENT.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
fastlane update_hybrid_common version:{new version}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Clearing Gradle Caches for Android Studio Updates
DESCRIPTION: Command to delete Gradle caches when Android Studio isn't updating packages correctly. This helps resolve dependency and package resolution issues.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/TROUBLESHOOTING.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
rm -rf $HOME/.gradle/caches/
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Purchases Hybrid Common
DESCRIPTION: This lane updates the purchases-hybrid-common version and optionally pushes changes to a new branch.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
[bundle exec] fastlane update_hybrid_common
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Fastlane Commands
DESCRIPTION: Essential Fastlane commands for initiating the release process and updating the hybrid common version
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/RELEASING.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
bundle exec fastlane bump
bundle exec fastlane update_hybrid_common version:x.x.x
npm run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Automatic Version Bump and Pull Request
DESCRIPTION: This lane automatically bumps the version, edits the changelog, and creates a pull request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
[bundle exec] fastlane automatic_bump
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Bumping Version and Creating Pull Request
DESCRIPTION: This Fastlane lane bumps the version, edits the changelog, and creates a pull request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
[bundle exec] fastlane bump
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Full Release Process
DESCRIPTION: This lane creates a GitHub release and publishes react-native-purchases and react-native-purchases-ui.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
[bundle exec] fastlane release
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Version Numbers
DESCRIPTION: This lane updates the version number in all necessary files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
[bundle exec] fastlane update_version
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Tagging Current Branch
DESCRIPTION: This lane tags the current branch with the current version number.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
[bundle exec] fastlane tag_current_branch
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating GitHub Release
DESCRIPTION: This lane creates a GitHub release for the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
[bundle exec] fastlane github_release
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Example Project
DESCRIPTION: This lane builds the example project in the repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
[bundle exec] fastlane build_example
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Triggering Version Bump
DESCRIPTION: This lane triggers the version bump process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
[bundle exec] fastlane trigger_bump
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Documentation
DESCRIPTION: This lane generates documentation for the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
[bundle exec] fastlane generate_docs
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Xcode Command Line Tools
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the latest version of Xcode command line tools, which are required for using Fastlane.
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
xcode-select --install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Environment File Reference
DESCRIPTION: File path reference for creating the Fastlane environment configuration file that stores the GitHub API token
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/RELEASING.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
fastlane/.env
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: GitHub Compare URL Pattern
DESCRIPTION: URL pattern for comparing changes between releases on GitHub
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/RELEASING.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
https://github.com/revenuecat/react-native-purchases/compare/<latest_release>...<base_branch>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: NPM Distribution Tag Command
DESCRIPTION: Command to update the latest npm distribution tag after a hotfix release
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/RELEASING.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm dist-tag add react-native-purchases@x.x.x latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Git Cherry Pick Command
DESCRIPTION: Command for cherry-picking commits during hotfix releases
SOURCE: https://github.com/RevenueCat/react-native-purchases.git/blob/main/RELEASING.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git cherry-pick <sha_of_the_squashed_commit_in_main>
```
